connector.description: Exchange messages with reactive stream processing libraries compatible with the reactive streams standard.

camel.source.path.stream.name: camel.source.path.stream
camel.source.path.stream.description: Name of the stream channel used by the endpoint to exchange messages.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: Number of threads used to process exchanges in the Camel route.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangesRefillLow.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangesRefillLowWatermark
camel.source.endpoint.exchangesRefillLow.description: Set the low watermark of requested exchanges to the active subscription as percentage of the maxInflightExchanges. When the number of pending items from the upstream source is lower than the watermark, new items can be requested to the subscription. If set to 0, the subscriber will request items in batches of maxInflightExchanges, only after all items of the previous batch have been processed. If set to 1, the subscriber can request a new item each time an exchange is processed (chatty). Any intermediate value can be used.

camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnComplete.name: camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnComplete
camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnComplete.description: Determines if onComplete events should be pushed to the Camel route.

camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnError.name: camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnError
camel.source.endpoint.forwardOnError.description: Determines if onError events should be pushed to the Camel route. Exceptions will be set as message body.

camel.source.endpoint.maxInflightExchang.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxInflightExchanges
camel.source.endpoint.maxInflightExchang.description: Maximum number of exchanges concurrently being processed by Camel. This parameter controls backpressure on the stream. Setting a non-positive value will disable backpressure.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.threadPoolMaxSize
camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.description: The maximum number of threads used by the reactive streams internal engine.

camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.threadPoolMinSize
camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.description: The minimum number of threads used by the reactive streams internal engine.

camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.threadPoolName
camel.component.reactive-streams.threadP.description: The name of the thread pool used by the reactive streams internal engine.

camel.component.reactive-streams.bridgeE.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.reactive-streams.bridgeE.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.reactive-streams.autowir.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.reactive-streams.autowir.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.reactive-streams.reactiv.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.reactiveStreamsEngineConfiguration
camel.component.reactive-streams.reactiv.description: To use an existing reactive stream engine configuration.

camel.component.reactive-streams.service.name: camel.component.reactive-streams.serviceType
camel.component.reactive-streams.service.description: Set the type of the underlying reactive streams implementation to use. The implementation is looked up from the registry or using a ServiceLoader, the default implementation is DefaultCamelReactiveStreamsService
